jsoul.midi

Class Chord

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsoul.midi.Chord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Chord>, Playable

    public class Chord
extends java.lang.Object
implements Playable, java.lang.Comparable<Chord>
    Represents a MIDI chord, containing multiple stacked notes.
    Author:
    Andrew Goldin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Chord()
      Default constructor: Generates a middle C major triad, mezzoforte, whole note.
      Chord(int[] p, int v, int d)
      Generates a new chord given a list of pitch values, a velocity, and duration
      Chord(java.lang.String pitchList, int v, int d)
      Generates a new chord given a list of pitch strings separated by spaces.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chord

        public Chord()
        Default constructor: Generates a middle C major triad, mezzoforte, whole note.

      • Chord

        public Chord(int[] p,
     int v,
     int d)
        Generates a new chord given a list of pitch values, a velocity, and duration
        Parameters:
        p - the list of pitch values (0 to 127)
        v - the velocity (0 to 127)
        d - the duration of the chord in midi ticks, where 1 tick is assumed to be one 16th of a beat

      • Chord

        public Chord(java.lang.String pitchList,
     int v,
     int d)
        Generates a new chord given a list of pitch strings separated by spaces.
        Parameters:
        pitchList - the list of pitches
        v - the velocity (0 to 127)
        d - the duration of the chord in midi ticks, where 1 tick is assumed to be one 16th of a beat

        public int getSize()
        Returns the number of notes in the chord.

      • transpose

        public void transpose(int steps)
        Transposes all pitches by the specified number of half steps. If a pitch cannot be transposed any higher or lower, it will not be affected.
        Specified by:
        transpose in interface Playable
        Parameters:
        steps - the number of steps (positive or negative) to transpose the Playable

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity(int v)
        Set the velocity (volume) of the chord.
        Parameters:
        v - the new velocity value (0 to 127)

      • getVelocity

        public int getVelocity()
        Returns the velocity of the chord.
        Returns:
        the velocity value

      • setDuration

        public void setDuration(int d)
        Sets the duration of the chord.
        Parameters:
        d - the duration value in midi ticks, where 1 tick is assumed to be one 16th of a beat

      • getDuration

        public int getDuration()
        Returns the duration of the chord.
        Returns:
        the duration value in ticks

      • getNotes

        public Note[] getNotes()
        Returns the notes in the chord as an array of note objects, sorted in ascending order from lowest to highest pitch.
        Returns:
        the list of Note objects

      • getNote

        public Note getNote(int i)
        Returns a note at a specific position in the chord.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the note (0 is lowest note)
        Returns:
        the Note object at the specified position

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the chord, giving each note with pitch, velocity, and duration.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the chord's String representation

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Chord other)
        Compares this chord to another chord by size (i.e. number of notes)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Chord>
        Returns:
        a negative value if the size is smaller, positive if greater, 0 if equal
